subject: Management
title: Real-Time Feedback Tools
description: A fast breakdown of Real-Time Feedback Tools for builders.

hook.text: A company replaced annual reviews with a weekly app ping: give or request feedback in two minutes.

buildup.text: Annual reviews happen too late. Real-time tools make feedback a continuous flow, not a yearly event.

discovery.text: Tools like 15Five and Lattice make feedback a lightweight habit instead of a heavyweight event.

twist.text: The tool doesn't matter. The habit does. Even a shared doc works if people actually use it.

climax.text: Choose any tool. Make feedback take under two minutes. Make it weekly. Watch the culture shift.

punchline.text: Make feedback easy and frequent. Everything else follows.

quiz.question: What matters most in real-time feedback systems?
options: Building a consistent habit of frequent lightweight feedback
Choosing the most expensive and feature-rich tool available
Ensuring every piece of feedback is formally documented
